meanings.definition: To take air into the lungs and then expel it
meanings.sent1: The puppy breathes quickly after running around the yard.
meanings.sent2: She breathes deeply to calm her nerves before the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The old car wheezes and breathes heavily as it struggles up the hill.
meanings.sent4: The forest breathes in the fresh air after a heavy rain, rejuvenated.
meanings.sent5: The singer breathes in harmony with the music, creating a beautiful melody.

meanings.sent1: Every living creature breathes to stay alive.
meanings.sent2: He breathes with joy as he watches his children play in the park.
meanings.sent3: The town breathes with excitement as the festival approaches.
meanings.sent4: The city breathes with the rhythm of life, bustling and vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The spirit of the forest breathes in the wind, ancient and eternal.

meanings.definition: To allow air to pass in and out of the lungs
meanings.sent1: The doctor instructs the patient to breathe slowly and deeply.
meanings.sent2: She breathes in the fresh mountain air, feeling rejuvenated.
meanings.sent3: The balloon breathes in and out as it slowly deflates.
meanings.sent4: The wind breathes through the trees, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The diver breathes underwater, exploring the colorful coral reef.
